Test Steps:
1. Navigate to http://taskmanager-uat.eastus.cloudapp.azure.com
2. Enter username: john.doe@contoso.com
3. Enter password: [valid password]
4. Click 'Sign In' button
Expected Result: User successfully authenticated and redirected to dashboard within 2 seconds
Actual Result: User authenticated successfully. Redirect time: 1.2 seconds

Test Steps:
1. Navigate to application URL
2. Enter valid username
3. Enter incorrect password
4. Click 'Sign In' button
Expected Result: Error message displayed: 'Invalid username or password'. No system details exposed.
Actual Result: Error message shown correctly. No sensitive information leaked.

Test Steps:
1. Attempt login with wrong password 5 times
2. Try logging in with correct password on 6th attempt
Expected Result: Account locked after 5 failed attempts. Error message: 'Account temporarily locked. Try again in 15 minutes.'
Actual Result: Account locked correctly after 5 attempts. Lockout message displayed.

Test Steps:
1. Click 'New Task' button
2. Enter Title: 'Inspect Machine A-103'
3. Enter Description: 'Monthly maintenance inspection'
4. Select Due Date: 2025-11-25
5. Select Priority: High
6. Click 'Save'
Expected Result: Task created successfully and appears in task list with all entered details
Actual Result: Task created. All fields saved correctly. Task ID: 12847 generated.

Test Scenario: Create New Task - Required Fields Only
Test Steps:
1. Click 'New Task' button
2. Enter Title: 'Update inventory'
3. Leave Description blank
4. Leave Due Date blank
5. Click 'Save'
Expected Result: Task created with title only. Optional fields remain empty.
Actual Result: Task created successfully with minimal data.

Test Steps:
1. Click 'New Task' button
2. Leave Title blank
3. Enter Description: 'Test task'
4. Click 'Save'
Expected Result: Validation error displayed: 'Title is required'. Task not saved.
Actual Result: Error message: 'Title cannot be empty'

Test Scenario: Update Task Status - In Progress to Completed
Test Steps:
1. Find task with status 'In Progress'
2. Click on task to open details
3. Change status to 'Completed'
4. Click 'Save'
Expected Result: Task status updated to 'Completed'. Completion timestamp recorded.
Actual Result: Status changed. Timestamp: 2025-11-18 14:23:45

Test Scenario: Update Task - Edit Title and Description
Test Steps:
1. Open existing task
2. Modify title from 'Check valve' to 'Inspect valve pressure'
3. Update description
4. Click 'Save'
Expected Result: Task updated with new title and description. Modified timestamp updated.
Actual Result: Changes saved successfully. Modified by: robert.taylor@contoso.com

Test Steps:
1. Select task from list
2. Click 'Delete' button
3. Confirm deletion in popup dialog
Expected Result: Confirmation dialog appears. Task deleted after confirmation. Task removed from list.
Actual Result: Confirmation prompt shown. Task deleted successfully.

Test Steps:
1. Select task
2. Click 'Delete'
3. Click 'Cancel' in confirmation dialog
Expected Result: Task not deleted. Remains in task list.
Actual Result: Task remained in list after cancel.

Test Steps:
1. Navigate to task list
2. Use status filter dropdown
3. Select 'Completed'
Expected Result: Only tasks with 'Completed' status displayed. Count updated.
Actual Result: Filter applied. Showing 47 completed tasks.

Test Steps:
1. Open date filter
2. Set start date: 2025-11-01
3. Set end date: 2025-11-18
4. Click 'Apply'
Expected Result: Tasks within date range displayed. Other tasks hidden.
Actual Result: Date filter applied correctly. 128 tasks in range.

Test Steps:
1. Enter 'inspection' in search box
2. Press Enter or click Search
Expected Result: All tasks containing 'inspection' in title or description displayed. Case-insensitive search.
Actual Result: Search returned 23 matching tasks. Highlighting of keyword would be nice.

Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Reports section
2. Select date range
3. Select 'All Tasks' report
4. Click 'Export to Excel'
Expected Result: Excel file downloaded with all tasks in selected range. Properly formatted.
Actual Result: File downloaded: tasks_20251118_142356.xlsx. Format correct.

Test Steps:
1. Open task details
2. Click 'History' tab
Expected Result: Complete audit trail displayed showing all changes with timestamps and user names.
Actual Result: History shows: Created by john.doe (11/15)

Test Steps:
1. 5 users access application simultaneously
2. Each user creates and updates tasks
3. Monitor response times
Expected Result: All users can access and use app. Response time remains < 3 seconds. No errors.
Actual Result: All 5 test users successful. Avg response: 1.4s. No errors.

Test Steps:
1. Simulate database disconnect (test environment)
2. Attempt to save task
3. Observe error handling
Expected Result: User-friendly error message displayed. 'Unable to save task. Please try again.' Retry option available.
Actual Result: Error message displayed correctly. Retry button present.

Test Steps:
1. Login to application
2. Remain idle for 30 minutes
3. Attempt to perform action
Expected Result: Session expires. User redirected to login with message 'Session expired. Please log in again.'
Actual Result: Session timeout after 30 min. Redirect to login worked.

Test Steps:
1. Access app on mobile device
2. Navigate to task list
3. Test scrolling and task selection
Expected Result: Task list displays properly. Touch-friendly buttons. Smooth scrolling.
Actual Result: Layout responsive. Buttons appropriate size for touch.

Test Steps:
1. On mobile device
2. Click 'New Task'
3. Fill in form fields
4. Save task
Expected Result: Form displays properly on mobile. Keyboard doesn't obscure fields. Save successful.
Actual Result: Form usable on mobile. Some fields slightly cramped.
Notes: Consider larger input fields on mobile

Test Steps:
1. Create new task
2. Enter title with 300 characters
3. Attempt to save
Expected Result: Validation error: 'Title must be 255 characters or less'. Client-side and server-side validation.
Actual Result: Client validation missing. Server returned 500 error instead of validation message.

Test Steps:
1. Create task with title containing special chars: <>&"'
2. Save task
3. View task in list
Expected Result: Special characters properly encoded. No XSS vulnerability. Display correct.
Actual Result: Characters encoded correctly. No security issues.

Test Steps:
1. User A opens task for editing
2. User B opens same task
3. User A saves changes
4. User B attempts to save
Expected Result: Conflict detected. User B notified: 'Task modified by another user. Refresh to see latest version.'
Actual Result: Conflict message displayed. Refresh option provided.

Test Scenario: Task Due Date - Past Date Warning
Test Steps:
1. Create task
2. Select due date in past
3. Save task
Expected Result: Warning displayed but allows save: 'Due date is in the past. Continue?'
Actual Result: Warning shown. User can proceed or cancel.

Test Steps:
1. Note existing task count
2. Administrator performs backup
3. Delete test tasks
4. Administrator restores backup
5. Verify tasks restored
Expected Result: Deleted tasks restored from backup. Data integrity maintained.
Actual Result: All tasks restored correctly. Checksums match.

Test Steps:
1. Ensure 1000+ tasks in database
2. Navigate to task list
3. Measure load time
Expected Result: Task list loads within 5 seconds. Pagination implemented (50 tasks per page). Navigation smooth.
Actual Result: Initial load: 3.2s. Pagination works. Total: 1247 tasks.

Test Scenario: Sorting - Task List by Due Date
Test Steps:
1. Open task list
2. Click 'Due Date' column header
3. Observe sort order
Expected Result: Tasks sorted by due date ascending. Click again for descending.
Actual Result: Sorting works correctly both directions.

Test Steps:
1. Enable screen reader (NVDA)
2. Navigate through application
3. Create and edit task using keyboard only
Expected Result: All elements accessible via keyboard. Screen reader announces all actions and content.
Actual Result: Keyboard navigation works. Some aria-labels missing on buttons.

Test Steps:
1. Select 10 tasks using checkboxes
2. Click 'Delete Selected' button
3. Confirm bulk delete
Expected Result: Confirmation shows count: 'Delete 10 selected tasks?'. All selected tasks deleted after confirmation.
Actual Result: Bulk delete successful. All 10 tasks removed.

Test Steps:
1. Generate task report
2. Click 'Print' button
3. Preview print layout
Expected Result: Print-friendly layout without navigation elements. Proper page breaks. Company branding included.
Actual Result: Print preview looks professional. Layout clean.

Test Steps:
1. Open task
2. Click 'Assign to' dropdown
3. Select user from list
4. Save
Expected Result: Task assigned to selected user. User receives email notification.
Actual Result: Assignment works but email notification delayed by 5 minutes.
Notes: Email notification delay acceptable for now

Test Steps:
1. Open task details
2. Enter comment in comment box: 'Requires supervisor approval'
3. Click 'Add Comment'
Expected Result: Comment added with timestamp and username. Visible to all users with access to task.
Actual Result: Comment added successfully. Shows: Chris Rodriguez - 11/18/2025 2:45 PM

Test Steps:

2. Click 'Attach File'
3. Select PDF file (2 MB)
4. Upload

Actual Result: Upload successful: maintenance_checklist.pdf (2.1 MB)

Test Steps:
1. Attempt to upload file > 10 MB
2. Observe validation
Expected Result: Error message: 'File size exceeds 10 MB limit'. Upload rejected.
Actual Result: Validation works. Clear error message displayed.

Test Steps:
1. Navigate to dashboard
2. View summary widgets (Total Tasks, Completed, In Progress, Overdue)
3. Verify counts accurate
Expected Result: Widget counts match actual task counts. Charts update in real-time.
Actual Result: All widget counts verified accurate. Pie chart showing task distribution.

Test Steps:
1. Create task with due date tomorrow
2. Wait for daily notification job (or trigger manually in test)
3. Check for notification
Expected Result: Email notification sent 24 hours before due date: 'Task Due Tomorrow: [task title]'
Actual Result: Notification received in test. Email format professional.

Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Settings
2. Select 'Dark Theme'
3. Apply changes
Expected Result: Application switches to dark theme. Preference saved for user.
Actual Result: Theme changed successfully. Persists after logout/login.

Test Steps:

2. Select tasks
3. Choose 'Export as JSON'
4. Download file
Expected Result: JSON file downloaded with properly formatted task data. Valid JSON structure.
Actual Result: JSON file valid. Tested with JSON validator. Structure correct.

Test Steps:

2. Retrieve authentication token
3. Use token for API request
Expected Result: Bearer token returned. Token valid for 1 hour. API request succeeds with valid token.
Actual Result: Token received. API calls working with authentication.
